974332585047478273.name: @solana_jordi @albertcardona @ricard_sole @Baldscientist That "definition" of individual is what I find problematic. In any complex organism, the "parts" (cells or others) are strongly interdependent, and just considering their inability to "live in their own" seems a bit limited of a criterion. On organisms: https://t.co/BdsWKamEgv

content.html:
@DialecticalA @WiringTheBrain To illustrate your point (left). Specificity is build up during development by the selection among the varied structures "enabled" by the available gene products. Development and evolution are radically constructive.
dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/2330784.2330946
